pulltitle: Switched broken pypip.in badges to shields.io
pullsbody:
Hello, this is an auto-generated Pull Request. ([Feedback?](mailto:repobot@movermeyer.com?subject=pypip.in%20Badge%20Bot%20Feedback%3A%20funfactory))

Some time ago, [pypip.in](https://web.archive.org/web/20150318013508/https://pypip.in/) shut down. This broke the badges for a bunch of repositories, including `funfactory`. Thankfully, an equivalent service is run by [shields.io](https://shields.io). This pull request changes the badge to use shields.io instead.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message: Switched broken pypip.in badges to shields.io

pulltitle: Accommodate LOGGING values which are not dicts
pullsbody: As Django allows for a `Version` key in the `LOGGING` dict as described in [the docs](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/topics/logging/#examples) which has a non-dictionary value (an integer), funfactory should not throw a `'int' object has no attribute 'update'` error when parsing the LOGGING setting.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Accommodate LOGGING values which are not dicts

As Django allows for a `Version` key in the `LOGGING` dict as described in [the docs](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/topics/logging/#examples) which has a non-dictionary value (an integer), funfactory should not throw a `'int' object has no attribute 'update'` error when parsing the LOGGING setting.

This changes funfactory to use jingo.monkey which monkey patches Django
form fields so you don't have to do |safe all the time.

If the available jingo isn't recent enough, then it defaults to using
nuggets safe_django_forms which don't appear to work with Django 1.5
or later.

This changes funfactory to use jingo.monkey which monkey patches Django
form fields so you don't have to do |safe all the time.

If the available jingo isn't recent enough, then it defaults to using

or later.

pulltitle: Add exemption for lang param in locale middleware.
pullsbody:
There may be some URLs which have other uses for a
'lang' query parameter. This allows you to set such URLs as exempt.

This is mostly for bedrock, as we need the /firefox/download/ page
to accept a ?lang= parameter that refers to the language of the
Fx build you wish to download. That param for that page has existed
for a long time and we're trying to port it from the PHP side
to bedrock.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Add exemption for lang param in locale middleware.

There may be some URLs which have other uses for a
'lang' query parameter. This allows you to set such
URLs as exempt.

pullsbody:
In RedHat, if you do something like `pip install --install-option="--home=`pwd`/vendor-local" python-ldap` (same happens with `psycopg2`) they get installed in `vendor-local/lib64/python/...`. 

To be honest, I don't know why that happens on jenkins but not on my laptop. 

Anyway, adding this is harmless for those on sane systems that don't install into `lib64/python`. 

We needed this for socorro-crashstats so that psycopg2 and ldap could be used from the tarballs we build on jenkins. See [this code](https://github.com/mozilla/socorro-crashstats/blob/master/wsgi/socorro-crashstats.wsgi#L11-L13)
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message: don't forget lib64

pullsbody:
If locale/ isn't there or it's empty, it's possible for DEV_LANGUAGES
to have [] as a value. Then LANGUAGE_URL_MAP is an empty dict and the
Prefixer gets all confused and it's clownshoes on fire all the way
down.

This is a problem for contributors working on projects that don't
explicitly set `DEV_LANGUAGES` to something sane in their project
settings file.

r?
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Fix DEV_LANGUAGES

If locale/ isn't there or it's empty, it's possible for DEV_LANGUAGES
to have [] as a value. Then LANGUAGE_URL_MAP is an empty dict and the
Prefixer gets all confused and it's clownshoes on fire all the way
down.

pulltitle: Ensure that reverse returns a str object and add reverse_lazy.
pullsbody:
Certain parts of Django assume that URLs are str objects (as URLs are
ASCII-only) and break if given a unicode object. In many cases reverse
will return a unicode object because it builds URLs using 
`request.META['SCRIPT_NAME']`, which is a unicode string.

To handle this and any other situation involving unicode in a URL, we 
should use Django's `iri_to_uri` function to escape all unicode in the URL 
and return a str object.

Also adds reverse_lazy, which makes using reverse in decorators and 
settings files easier.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Ensure that reverse returns a str object and add reverse_lazy.

Certain parts of Django assume that URLs are str objects (as URLs are
ASCII-only) and break if given a unicode object. In many cases reverse
will return a unicode object because it builds URLs using 
`request.META['SCRIPT_NAME']`, which is a unicode string.

To handle this and any other situation involving unicode in a URL, we 
now use Django's `iri_to_uri` function to escape all unicode in the URL 
and return a str object.

Also adds reverse_lazy, which makes using reverse in decorators and 
settings files easier.

pulltitle: escape non-ascii characters in urlencode as utf8
pullsbody:
If you have a view that supplies the template with some non-ascii unicode
characters and you do this in the template:

```
<a href={{ mydata|urlencode }}>
```

It will fail with a `KeyError` if it's not first escaped.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
escape non-ascii characters in urlencode as utf8

If you have a view that supplies the template with some non-ascii unicode
characters and you do this in the template:

    <a href={{ mydata|urlencode }}>

It will fail with a `KeyError` if it's not first escaped.

pulltitle: [DO NOT MERGE] Fix branch reference for Django.
pullsbody:
Since Django switched to Github, all their tags broke and there
isn't a 1.3.X tag anymore. This fix allows sites that are still
on funfactory 1.0 for whatever reason to not break when pulling
in django via pip (some Affiliates contributors have run into this
issue).

Instead of merging this, I'm proposing to add this branch and move the 1.0 tag to it as it is just a fix for sites still on the old funfactory version (like Affiliates, which will upgrade soon).
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Fix branch reference for Django.

Since Django switched to Github, all their tags broke and there
isn't a 1.3.X tag anymore. This fix allows sites that are still
on funfactory 1.0 for whatever reason to not break when pulling
in django via pip (some Affiliates contributors have run into this
issue).

pullsbody:
After funfactory is done doing its thing, it leaves a parting message
that includes some command lines for running the server. However, these
totally fail until you've done some configuration which is documented
in some part at
http://playdoh.readthedocs.org/en/latest/getting-started/index.html

Seems like a good idea to mention the docs and that there's more
configuration work needed before the steps work.

r?
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Fix parting message

After funfactory is done doing its thing, it leaves a parting message
that includes some command lines for running the server. However, these
totally fail until you've done some configuration which is documented
in some part at
http://playdoh.readthedocs.org/en/latest/getting-started/index.html

Seems like a good idea to mention the docs and that there's more
configuration work needed before the steps work.

pullsbody:
So, with this change either of these work the same:

```
$ sudo pip install funfactory
$ funfactory --pkg=foo
Aww yeah. Just installed you some Playdoh.
(foo) $ ls foo/
```

or 

```
$ virtualenv foo_env
$ cd foo_env
$ source bin/activate
(foo) $ pip install funfactory
(foo) $ funfactory --pkg=foo
Aww yeah. Just installed you some Playdoh.
(foo) $ ls foo/
```

In other words, it doesn't bother to create a new virtualenv if you're already in one. 

The few people who use a virtualenv without activating it can still run `funfactory --venv=/path/to/my/venv --pkg=foo`

When this lands, I need to update the playdoh-docs to explain this.

pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message: Pull up LocalizingClient from kitsune.

pulltitle: Remove language code from admin interface.
pullsbody:
I recently ran into an issue with affiliates where IT blacklisted /admin on production, but the locale prefix got around the blacklist. We typically don't localize the admin interface, so it'd be nice to have funfactory remove the locale prefix. 

Kitsune and Kuma already do this, so I figured it's common enough to include as a default.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message: Remove language code from admin interface.

pullsbody:
Enables HTTP Only by default and alerts/warns developers of
insecure session cookies.

After realizing that there was no warning to devs or sysadmins of a site not using secure session cookies (which we should all be doing, I'd wager), I figured this belonged in playdoh somewhere.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message:
Make session cookies more secure

Enables HTTP Only by default and alerts/warns developers of
insecure session cookies.

pulltitle: Ignore hidden directories (like .svn) in the locale folder
pullsbody: Fixes a KeyError (https://gist.github.com/ff25e123656b1cfc66a5) I ran into on Mozillians with a locale folder that had a hidden, but perfectly valid, `.svn` folder in it. I think it's sane to ignore any hidden folders in that directory. r?

pull_commit_message: Patch our reverse for Django's

pulltitle: Add admin emails on 500 errors as a default logger
pullsbody: Playdoh wipes out default logging settings, which causes playdoh apps to not send emails on 500 errors when DEV=False. This adds that setting back in so Playdoh apps send these emails by default.
pull_repo_desc: The library to power Playdoh, Mozilla's Django template.  File issues in playdoh:
pull_commit_message: Add admin emails on 500 errors as a default logger for playdoh apps.

pulltitle: Add admin emails on 500 errors as a default logger
